item.title: 伯克希尔旗下太平洋电力公司支付5.75亿美元，以解决美国政府提出的野火索赔
item.description: 美国司法部周五表示，伯克希尔哈撒韦旗下公用事业公司太平洋电力公司已同意支付5.75亿美元，以解决美国政府就俄勒冈州和加利福尼亚州六起野火提出的损害赔偿索赔。这些野火烧毁了近29万英亩联邦土地。【原文：PacifiCorp, a utility owned by Berkshire Hathaway, , agreed to pay $575 million to resolve U.S. government damages claims related to six wildfires in Oregon and California that burned nearly 290,000 acres of federal land, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国最高法院裁决对全球经济几乎没有缓解作用
item.description: 尽管美国最高法院周五对特朗普总统使用关税的裁决，标志着其将贸易关税作为经济武器的策略遭遇重大挫折，但分析人士指出，这对全球经济几乎没有带来立竿见影的缓解。【原文：While the U.S. Supreme Court's ruling on Friday against President Donald Trump's use of tariffs marks a clear setback for his use of trade levies as an economic weapon, analysts say it offers little immediate relief for the global economy.】

item.title: 行业对美国最高法院就特朗普全球关税案裁决的反应
item.description: 企业界和行业团体对美国最高法院推翻特朗普紧急关税的裁决表示欢迎。这一裁决虽带来解脱，但企业仍需为即将到来的复杂退税流程做好准备。【原文：Businesses and industry groups hailed the U.S. Supreme Court's move to overturn Donald Trump's emergency tariffs, a ruling that brings relief but leaves companies bracing for the complicated refund process ahead.】

item.title: 彭博社报道称，美国证券交易委员会对AppLovin的调查仍在进行中
item.description: 彭博新闻周五报道称，美国证券交易委员会对营销平台AppLovin的调查仍在继续。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's investigation into marketing platform AppLovin is continuing, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 分析师称最高法院裁决后中国购买美国大豆的可能性降低
item.description: 分析人士称，在最高法院推翻特朗普全面加征关税的决定后，中国可能不太可能继续推进特朗普数周来大力宣传的又一笔美国大豆大宗采购。【原文：China may be less likely to follow through on another big purchase of U.S. soybeans that President Donald Trump has been touting for several weeks in the wake of the Supreme Court striking down Trump's sweeping tariffs, analysts said.】

item.title: 彭博社报道，康菲石油公司正考虑出售价值20亿美元的二叠纪盆地资产。
item.description: 据彭博社周五报道，知情人士透露，康菲石油正考虑出售其部分二叠纪盆地资产，作为其资产组合更广泛精简计划的一部分。【原文：ConocoPhillips is exploring a sale of some of its Permian Basin assets as part of a broader streamlining of its portfolio, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据备忘录显示，摩根大通正联合半导体行业协会（CHIPS）及国防官员，推动一项价值1.5万亿美元的安全计划。
item.description: 据路透社周五获得的一份备忘录显示，摩根大通已任命一批高级管理人员，以推进其在国家安全和经济韧性相关领域的业务拓展。【原文：JPMorgan Chase has appointed a group of senior leaders to advance its push into sectors tied to national security and economic resilience, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普下令实施临时性10%全球关税，以替代被美国最高法院否决的关税措施
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周五表示，他将实施为期150天的10%全球关税，以取代部分被美国最高法院否决的紧急关税措施。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that he would impose a 10% global tariff for 150 days to replace some of his emergency duties that were struck down by the U.S. Supreme Court.】

item.title: 特朗普表示将签署行政令，对全球商品加征10%关税。
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周五在简报会上表示，他将签署一项命令，根据1974年《贸易法》第122条对全球商品征收10%的关税，同时还将启动多项其他调查。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday told a briefing he would sign an order to impose a 10% global tariff under Section 122 of the 1974 Trade Act and would initiate several other investigations as well.】

item.title: 分销商和零售商可能错失特朗普关税退税
item.description: 缺乏进口商合法资质的分销商和零售商，可能因美国最高法院一项具有里程碑意义的裁决而错失高达1750亿美元的关税退税。【原文：Distributors and retailers that lack legal status as importers could miss out on as much as $175 billion in tariff refunds that may follow a landmark U.S. Supreme Court decision.】

item.title: 美联储洛根对通胀将持续回落持"谨慎乐观"态度
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里·洛根周五表示，货币政策已做好充分准备应对经济面临的风险，但她仍担忧通胀回落至美联储2%目标的速度不够快。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said Friday that monetary policy is “well positioned” to deal with the risks facing the economy, as she continues to have worries that inflation will not retreat to the Fed’s 2% target quickly enough.】

item.title: 一家家庭玩具企业如何应对特朗普的关税政策
item.description: 近三十年前，当里克·沃尔登伯格接管家族玩具企业"学习资源公司"时，政治和诉讼根本不在他的考虑范围内。然而后来，他竟成为美国最高法院近年最具影响力的裁决之一的核心人物。【原文：When Rick Woldenberg took the reins of his family's toy business, Learning Resources Inc, nearly three decades ago, politics and litigation were not on his agenda. Then he became a central figure in one of the most significant U.S. Supreme Court rulings of the last several years.】

item.title: 据消息人士透露，KKR正考虑以15亿美元出售BMC Helix业务。
item.description: 知情人士透露，私募股权公司KKR正考虑出售旗下信息服务提供商BMC Helix，该交易可能高达15亿美元。【原文：Private equity firm KKR is exploring a sale of its information services provider BMC Helix, which could fetch as much as $1.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 萨克斯全球公司解决供应商投诉后，获得法院最终批准10亿美元破产贷款
item.description: 美国破产法官周五最终批准了萨克斯全球公司的破产融资方案，该方案将为该公司提供10亿美元的新资金。此前萨克斯已与奢侈品牌供应商达成协议，这些供应商曾在该公司破产前对商品供应问题表示担忧。【原文：A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Friday gave final approval to Saks Global's bankruptcy financing, which provides $1 billion in new funding to the company, after Saks reached deals with luxury brand vendors that had raised concerns about goods to the retailer before it went bankrupt.】

item.title: 美国最高法院推翻特朗普裁决提振股市，或令债券市场恐慌情绪加剧
item.description: 美国最高法院周五推翻特朗普总统全面加征关税的裁决，虽使股价小幅回升，但可能重新引发所谓债券市场监督者对政府财政状况的担忧，从而引发国债抛售潮，推高债券收益率。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court's Friday ruling striking down President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs lifted stock prices a bit but could revive worries about government finances among so-called bond vigilantes, sparking a Treasury selloff that could push yields higher.】

item.title: 美联储官员博斯蒂克：GDP"相当强劲"的增长引发通胀担忧
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔·博斯蒂克周五表示，全年2.2%的经济增长率"是个相当强劲的数字"，其高位足以引发对持续通胀的担忧，并可能需要采取紧缩的货币政策来抑制经济增长。【原文：Full-year economic growth at 2.2% is "a pretty strong number" that is high enough to raise concerns about persistent inflation and likely require tight monetary policy to hold back the economy, Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国最高法院驳回特朗普的关税后，企业将如何获得退款？
item.description: 美国最高法院周五裁定，特朗普总统依据经济紧急状态法征收的关税属非法行为。法院未说明政府应如何退还这笔非法关税，其金额估计达1750亿美元。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court said on Friday that tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump under an economic emergency law were illegal. The court did not say how the government should refund the illegal tariffs, worth an estimated $175 billion.】

item.title: Lucid为提升盈利能力裁员12%
item.description: Lucid周五宣布将裁减12%的美国员工，这家电动汽车制造商正致力于提升毛利率并实现长期增长。【原文：Lucid said on Friday it was laying off 12% of its U.S. workforce as the electric-vehicle maker seeks to improve gross margin and long-term growth.】

item.title: 英国预计最高法院裁决后将与美国保持良好贸易关系
item.description: 英国政府周五表示，在特朗普总统的大规模关税政策被美国最高法院推翻后，英国预计其与美国的特殊贸易地位将得以延续。【原文：Britain expects its privileged trading position with the United States to continue after the U.S. Supreme Court struck down President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, the government said on Friday.】

item.title: 企业庆贺战胜特朗普关税，但退税仍需时日
item.description: 当美国最高法院裁定推翻白宫紧急关税时，数千家企业赢得了一场艰苦卓绝的胜利。而退税流程才刚刚启动。【原文：Thousands of businesses won a hard-fought victory when the U.S. Supreme Court ruled to overturn the White House's emergency tariffs. The process of getting refunds has only just begun.】

item.title: 特朗普将于3月31日至4月2日访华，此行正值中美贸易紧张局势之际。
item.description: 白宫官员周五表示，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普将于3月31日至4月2日访华。在世界两大经济体关系紧张之际，这场备受瞩目的会晤日期就此敲定。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump will travel to China from March 31 to April 2, a White House official said on Friday, setting dates for a highly anticipated encounter amid tension between the world's biggest economies.】

item.title: 派拉蒙称美国反垄断机构对华纳兄弟收购案的等待期已到期
item.description: 派拉蒙影业周五表示，其以1084亿美元全现金收购华纳兄弟探索公司的美国反垄断审查等待期已于2月19日结束，这标志着收购HBO Max母公司的潜在交易迈出了重要一步。【原文：Paramount said on Friday the U.S. antitrust waiting period for its $108.4 billion all-cash bid for Warner Bros Discovery expired on February 19, marking a milestone on the road to a potential deal to acquire the owner of HBO Max.】

item.title: 美国12月新屋销售下滑；库存减少
item.description: 美国12月新独栋住宅销量下滑，但开发商在缩减库存膨胀方面取得进展，这可能使他们能够启动更多新住房项目。【原文：Sales of new U.S. single-family homes fell in December, but builders made progress in reducing an inventory bloat, potentially allowing them to break ground on more new housing projects.】

item.title: 美股大涨，因美国最高法院驳回特朗普关税案
item.description: 美国和欧洲股市周五大幅上涨，此前美国最高法院推翻了特朗普总统的关税政策——该政策是本届政府经济纲领的重要支柱。【原文：Stock markets in the United States and Europe jumped on Friday after the Supreme Court struck down U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs, a key pillar of the adminstration's economic platform.】

item.title: 特朗普在GDP数据公布前于社交媒体发文暗示数据低迷，归咎于政府停摆
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普似乎在数据公布前就预判了美国经济增长的年末表现令人失望，他批评民主党在去年秋季政府停摆期间扮演的角色拖累了经济总产出数据。【原文：President Donald Trump seemingly flagged a disappointing end-of-year reading on U.S. economic growth before it was made public, criticizing the role Democrats played in an extended government shutdown last fall that pulled down the economy's headline output numbers.】

item.title: 从"买美国货"到"再见美国"，华尔街出逃潮加速蔓延
item.description: 美国投资者正以至少16年来最快的速度撤出本国股市资金，因科技巨头回报率下滑，而表现更佳的海外市场显得更具吸引力。【原文：U.S. investors are pulling money out of their own stock market at the fastest pace in at least 16 years as Big Tech returns fade and better-performing overseas markets look more attractive.】

item.title: 据《The Information》报道，OpenAI正在开发包括智能音箱在内的人工智能设备。
item.description: 据《信息报》周五援引知情人士报道，OpenAI正投入逾200人研发一系列人工智能设备，产品线将包含智能音箱，可能还包括智能眼镜和智能灯具。【原文：OpenAI has more than 200 people working on a family of AI-powered devices that will include a smart speaker and possibly smart glasses and a smart lamp, the Information reported on Friday, citing a person with knowledge of the plans.】

item.title: 美国最高法院驳回特朗普的全球关税案
item.description: 美国最高法院周五推翻了特朗普总统依据国家紧急状态法实施的广泛关税措施，驳回了其最具争议的权力主张之一。该裁决对全球经济产生重大影响。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court struck down on Friday President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs that he pursued under a law meant for use in national emergencies, rejecting one of his most contentious assertions of his authority in a ruling with major implications for the global economy.】

item.title: 联邦监管机构批评联邦航空管理局对美联航维修操作的监管不力
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局对美联航维护操作的监管因人员短缺、员工培训不力以及获取航空公司数据的障碍而受阻，联邦监管机构周五表示。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration's oversight of United Airlines’ maintenance practices is hindered by low staffing, ineffective workforce training and hurdles to accessing air carrier data, a federal watchdog said Friday.】

item.title: 标普全球称美国2月商业活动增速放缓
item.description: 美国一项调查显示，2月份美国商业活动扩张速度创10个月来最低水平，工厂订单减少，服务业新业务增长放缓，就业增长全面停滞。【原文：U.S. business activity expanded in February at the slowest rate in 10 months as orders receded at factories, new business growth slackened for services firms and employment growth stalled across the board, a survey showed on Friday.】
